text.0: that highest indrapower of thine is distant that which is here sages possessed aforetime.
text.1: this one is on the earth in heaven the other and both unite as flag with flag in battle.
text.2: he spread the wide earth out and firmly fixed it smote with his thunderbolt and loosed the waters.
text.3: maghavan with his puissance struck down ahi rent rauhiṇa to death and slaughtered vyaṁsa.
text.4: armed with his bolt and trusting in his prowess he wandered shattering the forts of dāsas.
text.5: cast thy dart knowing thunderer at the dasyu increase the Āryas might and glory indra.
text.6: for him who thus hath taught these human races maghavan bearing a fameworthy title.
text.7: thunderer drawing nigh to slay the dasyus hath given himself the name of son for glory.
text.8: see this abundant wealth that he possesses and put your trust in indras hero vigour.
text.9: he found the cattle and he found the horses he found the plants the forests and the waters.
text.10: to him the truly strong whose deeds are many to him the strong bull let us pour the soma.
text.11: the hero watching like a thief in ambush goes parting the possessions of the godless.
text.12: well didst thou do that hero deed o indra in waking with thy bolt the slumbering ahi.
text.13: in thee delighted dames divine rejoiced them the flying maruts and all gods were joyful.
text.14: as thou hast smitten Śuṣṇa pipru vṛtra and kuyava and Śambaras forts o indra.
text.15: this prayer of ours may varuṇa grant and mitra and aditi and sindhu earth and heaven.
